paper_metadata.title: Understanding pathways through which an asset accumulation program affects mental health of AIDS-orphaned children: Evidence from Uganda

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: a family-based combination intervention, comprising economic strengthening and asset accumulation centered around micro-savings and financial management training and mentorship

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: To test the hypothesized relationships between the intervention, mediators (household wealth, child poverty, and child's work) and mental health
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: The study employed a cluster-randomized experimental design

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: we use data from the Bridges to the Future studyâ€”a 5-year (2011-2016) longitudinal cluster-randomized experimental intervention
evidence_citations.country_citation: administered in the South Western region of Uganda
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: conducted among 1410 school-going AIDS-orphaned children ages 10 and 16 years old in 48 primary schools
